node.title: Is it possible to make ElementMaterialSampler to sample value based on the centroid points of element instead of quadrature points
node.bodyText: Is it possible to make ElementMaterialSampler to sample value based on the centroid points of element instead of quadrature points

Hello
You can certainly modify it to make it so.
But currently in its present state, no
Guillaume

node.title: How to output the nodal multi-variable value as CSV file?
node.bodyText:
Hi developers, recently, I have been trying to use MOOSE to output all the variables on all the nodes or elements. I want a CSV with every row with the x and y coordinates of every node and corresponding variables (dispx, dispy, stress_xx, material properties etc.), but in MOOSE the displacement is nodal value and the stress, strain and material properties are element value, so if there's a way to change the element value to nodal value or change nodal value to element value so they can have be present in the same CSV file
  [Nodalvalue] type = NodalValueSampler sort_by = 'x' variable = 'disp_x disp_y' execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_END' [] [Elemvalue] type = ElementValueSampler sort_by = 'x' variable = 'vonmises_stress stress_xx stress_xy stress_yy strain_xx strain_xy strain_yy' execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_END' []

Hello
You can use the ProjectionAux to project to or from a nodal variable.
This will be good for postprocessing but there will be a projection error in some cases, which you can evaluate using the L2 norm different postprocessors
Guillaume

Dear Guid,
Thank you so much for your prompt reply. I have checked the ProjectionAux and examples but still can't understand how to use it.
(1) After my simulation, I will get a 'nodal_value file' & 'element_value file,' which are assigned to nodes and Gaussian points. what I want to achieve is to unify all the points (i.e., make all the variables in the nodes rather than Gaussian points, like stress & strain), this is my current code:
[VectorPostprocessors] [Nodalvalue] type = NodalValueSampler sort_by = 'x' variable = 'disp_x disp_y' execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_END' [] [Elemvalue] type = ElementValueSampler sort_by = 'x' variable = 'vonmises_stress stress_xx stress_xy stress_yy strain_xx strain_xy strain_yy' execute_on = 'TIMESTEP_END' []
(2) And can you teach me a little bit about how to assign the corresponding material properties to the points, I have tried using but still don't know how to play with it. Thank you so much, and this is the link to my whole code"https://github.com/Yulongggggg/test"
' [materialvalue]
type = ElementMaterialSampler
material = Materials
[]'

Hello
The ElementMaterialSampler should be sampling at the quadrature points. Are you asking about how to sample at nodes for material properties?
Can you unify at the sampler level ? E.g. sample all the variables using a NodalValueSampler or an ElementValueSampler
Guillaume

Hi, I have tried. If i implement like the image, it will pose error:"(VectorPostprocessors/Elemvalue/variable):check_inp(moose_srv)
The variable 'disp_x' is not elemental.check_inp(moose_srv)"

Q: for (The ElementMaterialSampler should be sampling at the quadrature points. Are you asking about how to sample at nodes for material properties?)
A: Is there a way I can sample all the variables at only nodes or only quadrature points? The reason I want to do it is I want put them into Machine learning modes, so I wish each point (no matter nodes or quadrature points) can contain all informations like disp, stress, strain
what I mean is I want to implement it in the post-process part
@GiudGiud

The variable 'disp_x' is not elemental.check_inp(moose_srv)"

let's just comment this out for now I think it will work for nodal variables.
Ill push a patch to enable this soon

this

Thank you! I wish there could be all the information on the quadrature points, for now, the displacements only exist on the nodal points, and it would be perfect to get displacements also on the quadrature points. When you enable the function could you please tell me? Thank you

You can already use these objects instead btw:
QuadraturePointsPositions to gather the quadrature point positions (in the Positions block)
PositionsFunctorValueSampler to sample all the variables (using their functor base class)

I looked and the ElementValueSampler will never be able to output nodal variables.
I recommend you use the PositionsFunctorValueSampler option.

node.title: Building libmesh on HPC - undefined reference to std:file_system
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 I have consulted the Posting Guidelines.
 I have searched the Discussions Forum and MOOSE Framework Troubleshooting and have not found what I was looking for
 Q&A Getting Started is the most appropriate category for my question (trouble installing, beginner user, ...)

Issue or question about MOOSE
Hi all,
I am building libmesh on an HPC. I running into issues with the update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh script. The configuration phase finishes successfully but I run into issues with the build portion of the script.
I posted what outputs on error into the log box below.
I'm not sure what is causing this. Some type of linking issue?
Let me know what else I can provide to help solve this issue.

node.title: Encountered an error while using MultiApp on the Alliance Canada cluster
node.bodyText:
Hi ,
I am currently running a multi-app simulation on the Alliance Canada cluster. The setup involves one application solving the Navier-Stokes equations and another solving the phase-field equation.
Initially, I attempted to follow the this  but I encountered errors during the process. Since Docker and Conda are not permitted on the cluster, my only viable alternative was to use Apptainer. When attempting to convert a Docker image to an Apptainer container, I ran into a similar issue as described in here(#27377) I also considered installing Conda inside an Apptainer container and using it to install MOOSE, but that approach was equally challenging.
Ultimately, I sought assistance from cluster support. They installed MOOSE via Apptainer for me, and I now source MOOSE following this . However, when running my simulation, I encountered the following error:

Error Output:
filesystem error: cannot check if file is empty: No such file or directory [PF_out_cp/1048-restart-0.rd]
application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0
[unset]: write_line error; fd=-1 buf=:cmd=abort exitcode=1
:
system msg for write_line failure : Bad file descriptor
srun: error: nc31413: task 24: Exited with exit code 1
libMesh terminating:
filesystem error: cannot check if file is empty: No such file or directory [PF_out_cp/1573-restart-0.rd]
...

This error appears to be related to file system issues with the restart files.

Additional Context:
Here is my working directory and its contents:
[pasha77@narval3 ghosh2]$ ls
ghosh_test.err  NS.i       simulation.e       simulation.e-s004  simulation.e-s007  simulation.e-s010  simulation.e-s013  simulation.e-s016  simulation.e-s019

job.sh          PF_out_cp  simulation.e-s003  simulation.e-s006  simulation.e-s009  simulation.e-s012  simulation.e-s015  simulation.e-s018
[pasha77@narval3 ghosh2]$ cd PF_out_cp/
[pasha77@narval3 PF_out_cp]$ ls
0522-mesh.cpa.gz   0530-restart-0.rd  0768-mesh.cpa.gz   0775-restart-0.rd  1047-mesh.cpa.gz   1585-restart-0.rd  4420-mesh.cpa.gz   9046-restart-0.rd  9260-mesh.cpa.gz   9371-restart-0.rd
0522-restart-0.rd  0533-mesh.cpa.gz   0768-restart-0.rd  0777-mesh.cpa.gz   1047-restart-0.rd  1828-mesh.cpa.gz   4420-restart-0.rd  9110-mesh.cpa.gz   9260-restart-0.rd  9462-mesh.cpa.gz

0525-restart-0.rd  0763-mesh.cpa.gz   0770-restart-0.rd  0779-mesh.cpa.gz   1293-restart-0.rd  2099-mesh.cpa.gz   7611-restart-0.rd  9126-mesh.cpa.gz   9292-restart-0.rd  9496-mesh.cpa.gz
0527-mesh.cpa.gz   0763-restart-0.rd  0774-mesh.cpa.gz   0779-restart-0.rd  1310-mesh.cpa.gz   2099-restart-0.rd  7873-mesh.cpa.gz   9126-restart-0.rd  9353-mesh.cpa.gz   9496-restart-0.rd

[pasha77@narval3 PF_out_cp]$ ls

Given these circumstances, could you confirm if the error is likely due to the Apptainer installation or another aspect of the setup? I would greatly appreciate your insights or guidance to resolve this issue.
Thank you for your time and support.
Best regards,
Mahdi

Hello
Can you find this file?
filesystem error: cannot check if file is empty: No such file or directory [PF_out_cp/1048-restart-0.rd]

Same for the other file.
It's very odd that it's look for restart files at different time steps at the same time?

could you confirm if the error is likely due to the Apptainer installation or another aspect of the setup

Does it run in a regular setup? Apptainer works fine for us on INL HPC

I checked on my laptop, and it was running, So I think it should be an installation issue. Also, the support mentions that it doesn't seem very easy to build Moose from the source  that is why they send me an Apptainer image.
Also this is the files I am using:

Click to expand the code for File1.i

    type = GeneratedMesh
    dim = 2
    nx = 25
    ny = 100 #

https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/actions/AutoCheckpointAction.html
set wall_time_checkpoint = false
The memory is not an issue I have checked that. Also, I will test  set wall_time_checkpoint = false.

node.title: A nuclear multiphysics workflow using MOOSE, Cardinal, OpenMC, and Coreform Cubit
node.bodyText:
I wanted to share with the community one of Coreform's recent webinars that featured April Novak (@aprilnovak) and Patrick Shriwise (@pshriwise) sharing a nuclear multiphysics workflow in the MOOSE ecosystem (incl. Cardinal, OpenMC, and Coreform Cubit).

Thank you for reporting! We're on it for fixing this

Thank you for replies, @milljm, @GiudGiud!
I have re-run the test. But I still get the same results with the same failure.
I am glad to know that you are woking on this for fixing it. I am looking forward to hearing the news.

Hi @GiudGiud,

There is really no need to change versions of moose for this. This is benign.

node.title: How to output/assign Young's modulus and Possion's ration to every quadrature points in the output CSV file
node.bodyText: How to output/assign Young's modulus and Poisson's ratio to every quadrature point in the output CSV file, is there a method to implement this? For example, in this image, add two columns named Young's modulus and Poisson's ratio
@GiudGiud

MaterialValueSampler is the way to do this for output
For assignment, you can use a PiecewiseConstantFromCSV function and a PropertyReadFile for reading the locations & values. Then use the function in a GenericFunctionMaterial

node.title: Density primitive/pressure primitive and entropy variable implementation in NS modulus
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A Navier Stokes is the most appropriate category for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (avoid screenshots if possible, triple back quotes before/after pasted text, etc)

Question
Hello everyone,
I recently switched to use MOOSE, and I have been really enjoying the platform so far!
I have also been play with NS Modulus for a while, and I think the modulus only allow you to use one set of variables to solve the problem. However, for my research, I need to implement different sets of variables to solve Navier-Stokes equations. In specific, I will need to solve:

Density primitive variable $\mathbf{Y} = [\rho,\mathbf{u},T]^T$

Pressure primitive variable $\mathbf{Y} = [p,\mathbf{u},T]^T$

Entropy variable $\mathbf{Y} = \frac{1}{T}[\mu,\mathbf{u},-1]^T$


where $\mu$ is chemical potential, $T$ is temperature, $p$ is pressure, $\rho$ is density and $\mathbf{u}$ is velocity.
Since these funcions are not there, I will have to implement them myself. I think the easiest option is write three different Action files where each handles their own variable, but this choice lead to many code repeatition, and potentially difficult to maintain in the future.
I am wondering if any one knows, or have any sugguestion, on how to design the code structure that:

Allows simple change of variables in the input file
Minimizes the code repeatition -- in principle, the main kernel should be same for all variables, and before enter the main kernel we convert the all variables into some standard variables.
Keeps the code as similar to current NS module structure as possible. Also reuse as much as of the current NS module.

Any feedbacks are welcome!
Additional information
Mesh size and type:
Reynolds number:
Discretization (finite element CG/DG, finite volume, etc):
Models (turbulence, porous media, etc):
Solver method (fully coupled, segregated, multiapps, etc):
Base input you started from:
Reference paper: "A comparative study of different sets of variables for solving compressible and incompressible flows" https://doi.org/10.1016/S0045-7825(97)00043-1

Hello
I would focus on getting something working then you can worry about using inheritance and other techniques to reduce the code duplication.
To do that, make a copy of every kernel you need, prefixing the new object name with "ConservedVar" for example, then modify them to use the conserved variables instead of the primitive ones
Note that both the thermal hydraulics module and the compressible finite volume kernels (CNSFV) already use the conservative variables.

node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
Hi,
I have made a small python package for doing UQ on workflows including MOOSE simulations. To make my work usable, I want to package it up with pip and incorporate some unit testing etc. Some parts of the code depend on MOOSE's python modules pyhit and moosetree for reading, modifying and writing input files for simulations. As far as I can tell, the only way to use pyhit and moosetree is to add them to my PYTHONPATH manually.
I was wondering, is there any way around this? For running CI unit tests, I do not really want to add MOOSE as a submodule and clone it for all the tests, since it is a pretty large repo and I only need a tiny part of it. As a worst-case scenario, I could just avoid writing tests for that part of the code.

Are you looking for the moose-pyhit package?
$> conda create -n testing moose-pyhit=2022
$> conda activate testing
$> python
>>> from pyhit import Node
>>>
Note: I am specifically informing you to install an older version (2022). The latest is not working, which I am attempting to fix: #29090.

Yeah, it looks like you're using an older instance of Conda. Not the issue, but just FYI if you are tired of lengthy solves (installing moose-dev using this instance of Conda will/is probably taking around 30 minutes), updating to a later release will greatly speed things up. To elaborate, your conda info should include this within the output:
         python version : 3.10.14.final.0
                 solver : libmamba (default)     <-------
       virtual packages : __archspec=1=m2
                          __conda=24.9.2=0
                          __osx=14.7.1=0
                          __unix=0=0

Anyways, the real issue here is that our packages are built using conda-forge's compilers. So you'll need to add that channel into the mix in order to install anything from our public channel:
conda config --add channels conda-forge
conda config --add channels https://conda.software.inl.gov/public
You'll get a warning about our channel already added but moving to the top... this is good
Once that is complete, try your conda create command again!

I just read that this may be an instance of Conda you don't have control over (HPC). If that is true, I think in that case the following should work:
conda create -n testing moose-pyhit=2022 \
 --channel https://conda.software.inl.gov/public \
 --channel conda-forge
That way, you're not modifying the channels in place already.
Thanks @milljm, I managed to download moose-pyhit! Do you know how to get moosetree? My code relies on moosetree.find

Indeed, comes with :)
>>> from pyhit import moosetree
>>> moosetree.__file__
'/Users/milljm/miniforge/envs/testing/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyhit/moosetree/__init__.py'
Perfect, thank you!

Oh, sorry. I should have demonstrated moosetree.find('node'). But I was more interested in demonstrating access to moosetree, without needing a clone of the moose repository.
Cheers!

node.title: Update source using generate command
node.bodyText:
I want to generate source markdowns for a new object only using  ./moosedocs.py generate command.
However it recreates markdown files even for all objects. How to avoid it and update only the specific object?

Hello
There is no option at the moment to do that officially.
You could hack it by :

changing the app_type of the one object
recompile
select the app_type using the --app_types after ./moosedocs.py generate
change the app_type back for the object

but at this point you might as well copy paste an existing documentation page and change the object name
Thanks for the hints!
